meanings.sent1: She had to shove the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: He used his shoulder to shove the door open.
meanings.sent3: Trying to shove a square peg into a round hole never works!
meanings.sent4: The strong wind seemed to shove the trees back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The bully tried to shove the smaller kid, but he stood his ground.

meanings.sent1: I had to shove the table to the other side of the room.
meanings.sent2: She gently shoved the plate closer to him on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to shove the toy mouse under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The river currents can shove debris downstream.
meanings.sent5: He had to shove the car out of the snowbank with all his might.

meanings.sent1: The knight had to shove his sword into the stone to prove his strength.
meanings.sent2: She had to shove the key into the lock to open the door.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to shove the vegetables into the blender to make a smoothie.
meanings.sent4: The rocket engines will shove the spacecraft into orbit.
meanings.sent5: He had to shove the stubborn drawer closed with a loud bang.
